title: What are some signs of a low performance employee? - Quora

response.answer_text: When my coworker screws up, I tend to use the “we” to soften things and not make it seem like it was his fault and his burden to bear alone. We got it bad as it is with a lazy boss that tries to make us to DO work while doing side business instead of staying at his post at work hours. The “we” makes it feel like a group effort so that my coworker does not feel left out, and that in many cases, most of the failure isn’t down to one person doing his job badly; and in most of THOSE cases, it’s usually not him, anyways, but my aforementioned lazy boss. You must also understand that sometimes, one’s performance is poor not because of his or her own volition. If you tell me to go somewhere to fix a fridge, and I haul my ass over there like the loyal worker that I am, but you didn’t tell me the fridge model was XYZ which required an entirely different set of tools and equipment and manuals, is it really my own poor performance or yours? On more than one occasion I had to go over my boss’s head and speak to his boss to explain my supposed mistakes. Which leads to the question of whether the subject is a superior or a coworker. Coworkers you include into the team. A superior who makes a mistake you can cover like a coworker. A superior who tries to pass the blame onto you, don’t hesitate to give a rude awakening.

Sometimes employee performance may poor due to many reasons like new technology project or No proper support received from upstream or downstream application or KT session are not happend or lack of understanding skills .In above case Managers has to discuss with employee to understand the reason and have to clear road blocks to improve the productivity. Eventhough employee are showing poor performance then Manager has to motivate and help to achieve the target.Then employee will get a chance to prove himself/herself. In a worst case scenario, poor performance employees will be in a layoff top list . Upvote : If you like this answer Follow: For more updates .
